intro: Astronidium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered starwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Astronidium micranthum is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
